io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.util

Class LoggerCSVFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Formatter
      • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.util.LoggerCSVFormat

  • @ThreadSafe
public class LoggerCSVFormat
extends java.util.logging.Formatter
    A Logger format that formats a log record for output to a CSV file. This allows for easier parsing of log data using a spreadsheet program. For maximum effectiveness, this Formatter is intended to be used alongside FileHandlers that output to a ".csv" file.

    In theory, the output this format produces will work with any spreadsheet program. However, to date it has only been tested with Microsoft Excel.

    NOTE ABOUT EXCEPTIONS: The full stack trace is outputted for any exceptions this formatter receives via the LogRecord. However, the format places each line of the stack trace on its own line within a single cell. Therefore, the stack trace might not initially be visible when the .csv file is opened, until the cell's height is changed.

    This allows for quick, at a glance viewing of an exception, and the ability to expand and see the full stack trace if needed.

    THREAD SAFETY: This formatter uses a counter to assign a unique index number to each record it formats. This counter is properly synchronized, allowing this formatter to be handled safely by as many threads as necessary.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
